habitat_description:
The range of A. piscivorus extends from southeastern Virginia, south along the Atlantic Coastal Plain well into the Florida Keys, west along the Gulf Coastal Plain, and south into the Mississippi Valley from southern Indiana, southern Illinois, Missouri, and central Texas (Ernst 1992). This species occupies aquatic and wetland habitats such as swamps, delta bayous, bayheads, ponds, and streams in pine flatwoods; pine-palmetto forest, off-shore keys. Also, marshes, river bottoms, dune and beach areas, and even drainages (Ernst and Ernst 2003, Campbell and Lamar 2004).

SW	-Restricted to lowland floodplains.
GP	-Also found in lowland floodplains.
SE	-Brackish coastal marshes, freshwater cypress swamps, bayous, lakes, rivers, ponds, and sandy or muddy streams. Forested wetlands, scrub-shrub wetland, and savanna.
